entry.title: The stillness behind his eyes
entry.summary:
Author: luvvave

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,047Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 2

Summary: Batman has never trusted anyone, never left his walls for anyone, always accustomed to solitude because he knows that if someone enters his world, nothing good will come of it. Even if his aloofness is perceived as displeasing by the rest of his team, he must do it for the greater good. After all, no one would believe that he is the billionaire Bruce Wayne. Clark has a crush on Batman and his imposing figure; he's fantasized about who he is beneath the suit. Later, he develops a crush on Bruce Wayne and his blue eyes. But after a mission, those eyes can be seen, and Superman knows who is behind that mask. That's how things change. But amidst the torment of discovering his identity, the two heroes, accustomed to distance, slowly learn that Batman can stay. And between glances that say more than any promise, Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent rebuild a closeness broken by the fear of losing.

entry.title: Two Heroes and a Baby
entry.summary:
Author: xxEmilee_Lunaxx

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 81,151Chapters: 22/?Kudos: 436

Summary: In this AU, 19-year-old Bruce Wayne adopts 4-year-old Dick Grayson after he is orphaned by a tragic event at Haly's Circus. Bruce is in over his head trying to juggle establishing himself as a responsible and valuable asset to Wayne Enterprises, beginning his vigilante work in Gotham as The Batman, and parenting a young child despite not knowing where to start. After struggling to get good press and constantly being seen as an irresponsible nepo baby, he sets up an interview at The Daily Planet. That's where he meets 19-year-old intern Clark Kent, who is eager to write a good story to begin his career as a journalist. After Clark agrees to keep an eye on Dick during his interview, Bruce realizes he has a knack for watching children, especially young Dick Grayson. Bruce asks Clark to come live with him at Wayne Manor on a 6 month assignment as Dick's nanny, and in return, will let Clark write the story of a lifetime--an expose on his life that no other reporter has even come close to. Clark reluctantly agrees, but is hiding a secret from Bruce--his life as the superhero, Superman! As the two begin their friendship and double lives as heroes, they learn valuable lessons in friendship, love, and parenting.

entry.title: what can still be known
entry.summary:
Author: rainbow_nerds

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,689Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 51

Summary: It was late in the evening when he noticed he was being followed. Two people, one man and one child from the sounds of their heartbeats. They lurked out of sight, but he could hear them, could feel them watching him.For hours, they followed him, from rooftop to rooftop. Clark usually went home in between helping people, tried to get some sleep. He wasn't batman, didn't feel the need to micromanage Metropolis the way the bat did Gotham. He couldn't argue with Batman's results of course—he did impressive work, would probably be a good teammate if Clark ever needed to call in backup again, but their styles were very different. Tonight, Clark took a leaf out of the bat's playbook, stayed out for hours, if only to avoid leading these people to his home.Finally, as night drew on, Clark had enough. He flew to the building where he heard the heartbeats and landed right in front of them. Or, twenty years after their first meeting, Clark Kent and Bruce Wayne cross paths again.

entry.title: one look at you (and I can't disguise)
entry.summary:
Author: burningredbutitsgolden

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,677Chapters: 2/6Kudos: 39

Summary: As he entered his bedroom window and changed out of his primary-colored suit, Clark's thoughts wandered to what Batman's eyes looked like beneath those lenses. Were they warm and brown, softening the angular shape of his face? It seemed unlikely. He didn't think his eyes would be cold, necessarily, but maybe more of a striking color. Blue, like ice? Perhaps green, a rarer shade to fit his mystery? For all Clark knew, they could be something else entirely. OR: Superman and Batman are obsessed with each other. It manifests in extreme fixations on the other's eyes.

entry.title: And Now It Follows Me Everyday
entry.summary:
Author: theFamousLivingDead

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,495Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 9

Summary: Gotham has a reputation that precedes itself, but these days even her city limits are overrun with chaos. The streets are littered with rumors about a new shape above the skyline. The docks have been taken over by gangs and civilians are forced to keep to a curfew for their own safety. Bruce Wayne is stumped when all his attempts to prevent crime from taking off in Gotham are thwarted by a lightningfast shadow. His worst nightmare comes true -- there is someone else out there, more powerful than he could ever train himself to be, and he's not on his side of history. In which Clark Kent went out to find more about himself and his origins, but the League of Assassins found him first.
